poem:
God's Chosen  

On a crowded São Paulo street,  
a man finds his voice among faithful echoes,  
his words painting futures in fervent hues;  
only two exits—  
a prison of walls or a prison of past,  
the freedom of conviction or the conviction of freedom—  
God's appointment etched into their chant.  
History, an altar, waiting for its sacrifice.
